title: How to Uninstall Games and Saved Data on PS4: Complete Guide

steps.title: Select Settings.
steps.content: Select Settings . This is the toolbox icon at the top toolbar. This method will show you how to delete multiple games at once. If you want to delete a single game, select it on your home page. Press Options on your controller and select Delete . Select OK .

steps.title: Select Storage.
steps.content: Select Storage . This is underneath Devices ; you may need to scroll down to find it.

steps.title: Select System Storage.
steps.content: Select System Storage . This should be the only option on the page. If you save your games to other locations , select Online Storage or USB Storage instead.

steps.title: Select Applications.
steps.content: Select Applications . This is the first option.

steps.title: On your controller, press Options.
steps.content: On your controller , press Options . This is on the right of the touchpad.

steps.title: Select Delete.
steps.content: Select Delete . This is in the right panel. You'll now see boxes next to all listed apps and games.

steps.title: Select the games you want to uninstall.
steps.content: Select the games you want to uninstall. You'll see a checkmark in the box.

steps.title: Select Delete.
steps.content: Select Delete . This is in the right panel.

steps.title: Select OK.
steps.content: Select OK . The game(s) will be deleted. The games' saved data will not be affected. If you want to delete the save data as well, continue to the next section .

steps.title: Select Settings.
steps.content: Select Settings . This is the toolbox icon at the top toolbar. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select Application Saved Data Management.
steps.content: Select Application Saved Data Management . This is underneath Themes .

steps.title: Select Saved Data in System Storage.
steps.content: Select Saved Data in System Storage . If you store your data elsewhere, select Saved Data in Online Storage or Saved Data on USB Storage Device instead.

steps.title: Select Delete.
steps.content: Select Delete . This is the last option.

steps.title: Select a game.
steps.content: Select a game. You'll see all games with saved data. If you want to select more than one game at a time, press Options on your controller and select Select Multiple Applications . Then, select all games with saved data you want to erase.

steps.title: Select Select All.
steps.content: Select Select All . If you only want to delete certain data, select it instead.

steps.title: Select Delete.
steps.content: Select Delete . This is in the left panel.

steps.title: Select OK.
steps.content: Select OK . This will delete the save data from your PlayStation 4.
